text: Hanasta @IOPP Tampere, ruskean samea väri, makeahkon simaisa, miellyttävä, hedelmäisä tuoksu.
Duft karamel malt sødlig honing bær smag malt malt sød vanilje bær svag vanilje
Bottle. be like an archaeologist tasting this historical beer stye, very old technique and juniper!
I didnt care for this, my first true sahti. The aroma is quite pungent, almost curdled milk. The flavor has a similar funk to it that just didnt work at all for me.

Chinesisch süß/sauer????? Irgendwie ja, aber das als Bier???? Der Trunk sauer,kräutrig unangenehm. Das Aroma ebenfalls extrem, aber auch alles andere als stimulierend. Ein bisschen extremsauerbierinteressant. Mehr leider nicht. Vom Hahn beim STRONGBOWS Stand während der KIELER CRAFT BEER DAYS 2016.

Tap @HBF 2016. Murky dark brown color. Tiny size, white head, stays as a ring. Sweet, raisins, juniper and smoke in aroma. Yeasty, sweet, raisins, banana, juniper in taste. Sweet, banana and fruity juniper in aftertaste. Soft to almost no carbonation. Nice and mellow. Very drinkable.

30th March 2016Bryggeri Helsinki. From an (official) plastic bottle, about a 6 pinter I reckon! Hazy amber beer, no head. Very modest carbonation. Nice tangy fruits, dried fruits and crystallised fruits, not that sweet. Orange, lemon and cranberry ensue. Traces of spice and herb. Light fruity tangy finish. Nice Sahti, goes down very easy.

0.33 l bottle @ Bryggeri Helsinki. Brown cloudy colour. No head. Taste is a bit sweet since sahti has no hops at all. There is also some banana taste. Lammin sahti is my favourite in this style. Well, I have sampled actually just a few of them, since they are not widely available.
Many thanks to Janne for this - Pours brown - nose/taste of banana bread, tree bark, sorghum, juniper branches and light tobacco - medium body

From my Sahti source VastActiv, so they now put this in bags however he diddnt think he could get through customs with it so poured in some traditional plastic bottle. Pours a flat brownish red with no head. Nose is tobacco, berry, and bready. Tastes of juniper, fruit punch, banana bread, menthol cigarettes, and some pecan. Chewy mouthfeel. I had the American made version of this brew on tap which seem more juniper and less menthol. Either way love me some Sahti not sure what it is about this strange brew.
Sample at Örebro Öl & Whisky 2015. Spicy, malty and yeasty smell. Similar taste. Low carbonation. Well hidden ABV, felt more like 5%. I think this was my first real sahti.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2015 On draught at Villi Wäinö in Helsinki and stopper-bottled direct from the brewery. That means it was the Finnish version, not the collaboration brew or something transported informally to some far-off place - Lammin Sahti has no hops and so does not travel. I am too old and polite to launch a screaming rant at ignorami who think that just because they dont get it there is something wrong with it, rather than that they have limitations. Sahti is a folk beer style. It pre-dates Ratebeerians by several centuries. You judge it by its own standards not todays simpler ones. If a sahti smells and tastes of banana bread that is because it is supposed to taste like banana bread. It is a rye beer fermented with bakers yeast or cultivated softer-end wild yeast, filtered by and infused with juniper (branches not berries) then packaged for consumption. By all means conclude it is not for you but dont even dare to contemplate that it is not for the world. It will outlast IPA à la mode, I would like to bet. And this is not A sahti, it is THE sahti.  The other Finnish sahti brewers may be the equal but none yet surpasses it.

On tap at The Ruck. Pours a deep brown to black with a thin tan head. Warm banana and juniper. On the thin side of medium, tart and roasty. Pine and banana, warm roast, a hint of cocoa. Sweet into the finish,a bit of smoke, cocoa, banana.
Tap @ Brygga. Pours hazy beige. Bananas and wheat with yeast. Fruity with banana and some licorice and yeast. Sticky with wide body, sour and sweet.

Ticked at Redlight. Quite gross. The flavors are just bizarre, and leave a lasting aftertaste of ??? I drank an entire glass in the interests of science. But I want to try a halfway decent Sahti before I give up on the style entirely...

Keg at SOPP, Helsinki.
Ive tried this a couple of times from bottle from Alko in Finland and havnt thought it was any good compared to the Swedish Gotlandsdricke.
Here at the festival were the sahti was fresh it was much more refreshing and nice in the taste and far the best Sahti at the festiva.

Draft at red light. Sweet sahti tick! Nose is weird. Hmmm. Earthy, light licorice or something. Nearly black with a small off white head. Some sort of weird juice flavor with a light tartness. Taste just kind of falls flat. I guess I dont get this style. Just meh.

Straight from a 3l plastic bottle at One Pint Pub. It pours murky deep brown with minimal head. The nose is bitter-sweet, fragrant, earthy, dark fruits, jammy fruits, peppery juniper, herbal and caramel. The taste is smooth, bitter-sweet, dark fruits, jammy berry, figgy pudding, Dandelion & Burdock, umami, blackcurrant, throat lozenges, bubblegum and herbal action with a smooth finish. Medium body and low carbonation. Hides abv very well. Quite drinkable actually. Good.
This poured an orange color with a white head. Aroma was caramel, and herbal. Flavor was mildly juniper, light tartness and malt. Weird.

Draft. Dark ruby, basically brown. A lot of banana flavor, some raspberry, vinous cherry, chocolate, and bubble gum. Semi-thin texture and very light overall. Solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Brown/ruby with little head. Juniper, coconut, chocolate, banana and sweet malt. A weird combo but not bad.
22.5.2014. Fruits, banana, caramel and wheatbeer in aroma. Taste is similar, quite heavy. Still new to sahti, small amount is ok.
Had this in a bar in Helsinki, poured a dark brown into a dimpled mug with no head, spiced aroma and quite a tart taste.
Pours brown with no head. A strong aroma of bannanas and bubble gum. My first sahti and I enjoyd it very much.

Tap at Bryggeri Helsinki. Murky orange/brown shade with no head. Not too appealing but Ill forgive it. Aroma is bread, berries, rubber. Mouthfeel a little oily. Taste is pretty complex. Similar to the aroma but also slightly smoky. I also get a better sense of the juniper than the Finlandia example I tried. This may be closer to the style guidelines, but I like it less as a beer.

Draught, from a barrel (or lookalike). Pours brown in color with a small bubbly
head. Sweetish dark bready notes, juniper and bit of earthy forrest
in aroma. Juniper, light woodyness, sweet dark ripe fruityness in
taste. A lot of nice juniper kind of notes here. A buzzer indeed.
Juniper juniper.
Sweet fudge (almost slightly burnt) kind of notes in aftertaste.
Maybe most famous finnish sahti. Fruity, well-bodied and very tasty! When its not botlled in some cases, when served from 5.0 l plastic can, it looses its carbonation after opening very soon.
On tap at SOPP 2014. My first ever sahti. Cloudy orange brown with no head. Smell is sweet syrup, juniper and yeast. Taste is sweet malt, syrup, honey and yeast. No bitterness and low carbonation.
Tap @ sopp. Pours hazy orange with no head. Juniper, banana, wheat in the aroma. Sweet, juniper, wheat flavor.
Tap at hbf 2014. Cloudy brown color, small white head. Aroma of syrup, malts, yeast similar to finnish Sima. Flavors have yeast, sweetness, malts, bread. Interesting brew.
Tap at hbf 2014. Hazy brown color, small white head. Aroma is sugar, malts, yeast. Taste is yeast, sweetness, malts, bread.
Tuoksussa katajaa, ruskea melko kirkas väri jopa. Pehmeä sahtimainen maku. Täyteläinen olomuoto.
Plastic canister. Pours hazy brown with no head. Aroma is malty with very strong and sweet banana. Taste is malty and very sweet. Not much carbonation.

3 l canister from Tuulonen. Headless dark brown. Some yeasty and banana flavour. Sweet and thicky.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a large plastic canister at Bryggeri Helsinki. Cloudy to brown without much of a head. Mild spicy aroma with juniper and hints of caramel. Quite strange brew. Almost no carbonation. Medium sweet with some acidity and a dry and spicy finish. Strange, certainly not a favourite, but quite nice juniper flavour. (2013-08-17)

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 15.08.2013, served from a plastic container @ Bryggeri Helsinki:
No head, just some random bubbles. Aroma is slightly strange fruity, yeast, honey, caramel, grain, dried fruits, banana, wet hay, weeds, dark sugar, herbs. Taste is sweet, yeast, honey, grain, hay, herbs, weeds, caramel, banana, sugar, cardboard, dried fruits. Little bitterness, slightly watery mouthfeel. Interesting.

On tap at Helsinki Brewery.  8% or so, apparently filtered through juniper branches & traditionally drunk from a mug made of juniper to highlight the flavor! A muddy opaque honey brown pour, flat. Great spice ara, molasses, cinnamon & caramel. Boozy! Interesting flavor, sweet, some woodsiness, caramel like those Halloween candies I used to get. Nice mouthfeel, smooth. Id like to try it with ice cream.  Sahti is a must try when un Finland.

Hazy, dark amber color. Minimal head, low carbonation. Sweetish aroma with some juniper. Taste is slightly more bitter than aroma but with malty touch. Also some phenolic flavors. Alcohol is clearly distinguishable. A dryish finish with a metallic flavor. This is one of those beers which are definitely worth of tasting, but one glass might be enough. (Draugh at the craft beer festival in Helsinki).

Opaque cloudy copper orange beer with a huge creamy permanent head. Aroma and taste are mostly banana and sugary sweetness. The sweetness is kind of overwhelming towards the end of the glass and also a floury yeastiness enters at that point. Medium thickness and finish.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2013 Poured from a plastic container @ Bryggeri Helsinki.
Pours a cloudy deep amber, no head.
Phenolic, herbal aroma, caramel, wheat, yeast, honey, apples, earth. 
Off dry, medium body, low bitterness, low CO2. 
Taste as aroma, slightly sour, faint smoke, really phenolic. 
Interesting. My British friends dubbed this the worst beer ever. :o) (2013-07-20)
The beer came from a really dodgy looking canister. Sweet taste with some sour after tastes.
Gravity Cask. Hazy golden pour. Swee juniper aromas. FLavor is sweet, with spice and juniper. Man my day in finland had barely begone and these ratings have gone to short and sweet.

On tap at the One Pint Pub

I wanted to drink local but sahtis turned out to be more elusive than I thought. This one was highly recommended so as soon as I found it on the tap handle I know which beer I was starting with. Fresh it is amazing and definitely vastly better than the bottled ones I have found stateside.

Aroma / Appearance - The caramel red base holds a fizzy bubbly head. It has a striking color almost like liquid red licorice. The handful of juniper, light chocolate, and wildness give the feel of drinking in a rural cabin far from the noise of a city during a long winter.

Flavor / Palate - Gooseberries, figs, and juniper awaken the palate. After the first wave it builds up until it becomes a bit like drinking licorice candy. The Hersheys kiss finish is accented by fig newtons. If not for the price and other bottles to sample I would have drunk this all night.

Draught @ SOPP Turku 2013. Murky brownish orange liquid with no head as it goes with sahtis. Aroma is sweet and has malts, yeast and bananas. Sweet flavour is also very bananic with malts and bun yeast.
Draught at HBF 2013, Helsinki. Colour is dark orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Banana, grain, sweetness, hints of alcohol and malts.

Draught @ One Pint Pub. Rated on 19.02.2010
Aroma is sweetish with banana esthers, some caramel and herbal notes. Flavour is sweet with banana esthers, bun yeast, rye and malty notes. Too much on the sweet side  and feels a bit straightforward too.

Juotu "hanasta". Kaatuu lasiin ruskeana, sameana ja vaahdottomana. Hajussa on banaania, mallasta, alkoholisuutta, sitruunaa, greippiä ja ruohoa. Maku on marjainen, banaaninen, mansikkainen, hieman alkoholinen, katajainen ja ruohoinen. Suutuntuma on mieto ja alkoholi tuntuu. Kokonaisuutena suht maistuva ja mieto olut, mutta vähän pliisuksi tämä jää.

From cask at One Pint Pub. Clear red liquid with almost no head just small white bubbles. Aroma is sweet berries, nice malty, juniper twigs maybe. Taste is sweet slightly tart berries, nice malty touch. Hard for me to describe since my tasting notes are from memory. Will have to revisit this one!
211212. From plastic jug, Nordic, Tampere. Pours hazy brown with almost no head. Aroma banana, what, bread yeast. Strong banana sweet taste. Not Bad.

Well it was different, not sure Id want to try it regularly, but pleasant enough. Dark and dim with no head, aroma of banana, flavour more of the same with caramel malt and quite a sweet/dry aftertaste.

Hazy brown color, no head or carbonation. Doesnt look like much but all the other elements in sahti more than compensate. Aroma is full of banana, juniper and spices. Taste is really sweet, spicy and fruity. Hops are compeletely missing, bananas and spices dominate. Taste is strong but palate is only medium bodied and very slick - deceptively easy to drink. Sahti is a unique beer style and Lammin Sahti represents it well. Either you love it or dont - I do!
Very hazy and dirty yellow.  No carbonation, no head. Banana, juniper and yeast. I could drink this by the gallon.
Pours clear brown with no head. Aroma is malts and banana. Flavor is malts, some wheat and banana. Pretty basic sahti. Not bad.

A dark brown beer with a almost without head. Aroma is sweet, bananas, yeast and some herbs. Taste is sweet, some juniper and spicyness, simple but nice. Full bodied, no carbonation, smooth to drink. Balanced and sweet, nice spicyness, basic and good.
Tar and extreme sweetness. Yeast. Licorice in aftertaste. Cloudy amber colour. Very lasting tar aroma. Oily.

Plastic canister @ 101 Beers, Tampere.
Originally rated on 20100219. (7+3+7+3+14)
Pours cloudy brown color with no head. Aroma of juniper, ripe fruits, yeast and some heral notes. Flavour of yeast, ripe fruits, herbs and caramel malts.
4324
Cask at One Pint Pub, darker iced tea color, lots of flavor, juniper, somthing like cinnamon that Im sure thats not cinnamon. Orange zest. Very flavorful and quite good

Served with a large bubble, sudsy head the color of the brew which was a hazy dark amber. Aroma was spice, licorice, malt. Flavor is similar but butterscotch is present also. Plus a bit of tang. Body and carbonation are true to style. Finish is like flavor and quite long. Seems to be what a sahti is all about except for the butterscotch which Im not a huge fan of.
A bit of sweetness, doughy, bananas (overripe ones) on the nose. Weizen-style easters on the palate. Rye? Thick and soft, Feels very nurishing, like drinking whole milk.
Sweet and slightly sour but then I think I got an old bottle. Some banana aroma and resin.  Very unusual. Serving: Bottle

Tap @ SOPP Helsinki. Pours murky brown orange with a minimal shortlived beige head. Aroma is yeasty, sweet, spicy, bready and malty. Flavour is yeasty, sweet, some bananas and malty. Finishes sweet and yeasty.
Draft at One Pint Pub.  Aroma and taste of sour banana and weeds.  I assume this is an acquired taste.
Deutlich bananiger Geruch, nicht sehr süß. Bananig-frischer Antrunk, leicht süßlich und mittelwürzig. Deutlich kräftiger werdend, grasig, nett. Zum Ende deutlich bananiger. /10/10/8//9

From a plastic container, Villi Wäinö, Helsinki. Pale ruby, cloudy at the edges with the faintest necklace of bubbles. Slightly dribble-making blackcurrant and banana yoghurt aroma liberally peppered with clove- 9? Smooth, thick mouthfeel, huge banana and clove, lightly smoked blackberry afters. Almost peaty, juniper, slight sugar tackiness. Top end RB (reindeer-beater), a level of complexity and juiciness above Finlandia.

Poured from a plastic tank and shared with Matti at Villi Wäinö. Opaque, dark-orange in body appearance. Just some small dimples at the surface. Dried fruity nose. Sweet taste of honey, grainy malts, ripe banana and dried fruits along with spices towards the ending. Very sweet, but worth drinking (Helsinki, 06.02.2011).

Tap @ One Pint Pub.
Pours a deep hazy brown colour with a massive foamy head, which disappears quickly. Grainy on the nose with banana, wheat and caramel. Weak flavour of caramel, wheat and banana. Alcohol pushes through. Medium bodied, oily/watery texture and soft carbonation. Average.
Draught @ SOPP Helsinki. Pours opaque yellowish brown, no head. Taste is sweet, palate is flat and thick. Aromas have wheat, cereal, banana, doughy yeastiness.

First from a plastic container at Villi Wäino, then again later on at One Pint Pub courtesy of Ossi (thanks!) . Poured a murky red body with a  tiny but strangely persistant white head clinging to the edges (not so at OPP). The nose was sweet and lovely, grainy full, glue and carrots, quite nice. The taste, however, showed that the first sample was off. Only some light carrot taste, sweet, banana peel too, some burn. The OPP sample revealed a fuller, more balanced banana presence. The body is light compared to the Finlandias, which was additionally detracting with the first sample but perfectly acceptable with the other one, making it slightly more balanced but less exciting than the Finlandias. The initial rate was 7/4/3/2/8, the in-form one is 7/4/7/3/13

Carton de 3 litres rapporté de Finlande. Bière ambre. Le nez est fascinant avec des épices, genièvre, sapinage. La bouche est très épicée, mince pour lalcool par contre. À boire sans faute, un produit spécial.

Name: Lammilaista Sahtia
Date: January 30, 2010
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting
Appearance: opaque dark yellow. wispy off white head
Aroma: sweet spicy honey aroma
Flavor: sweet malt flavor, lots of balancing spicyness, light bitterness
Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 11/20
Rating: 2.7/5.0Drinkability: 6/10
Score: ** /4

Banana and clove on the nose with hints of vanilla and nutmeg.  Pours amber with no head.  Mild tartness with banana and clove notes, vanilla, nutmeg, and hints of cinnamon, with a sweet spicy and slightly tart finish.  Very nice.
12 oz bottle.  Hints of raspberry, dried leaves, and rubber in the nose.  Very smooth drinking.  A little sweet and fruity upfront.  Nice pungent aftertaste.  Pretty good stuff.

Bottle. Aroma of overripe fruits, mint, orange peel, clove. Flavor starts off sweet and pruny with hints of toffee before mint and citrus seeds come in followed by grapefruit juice, citric notes, and bitter berries. Seemed very unbalanced at first, but ended up coming together alright.
Little bottle. Grassy aroma of hops. Hazy yellow color. Flavor is sour. Like some  old estonian home-brewed beer. Interesting, only for one time.

This bottle is a recent import and I was excited to get to try it.  It was served at cellar temperature.  With the pop of the cap I see this is not carbonated.  So the pour has no head, just some air bubbles from the agitation.  The beer is a dirty, muddy, blond; does not look appealing.  Aroma is actually malt driven with thick biscuit but that is joined with some exotic spiciness (berries but not cannot say that it is juniper precisely).  Flavor has more juniper in it and a lesser malt (biscuit) character.  Finishes light with an herbal character.  Its a nice beer but the lack of carbonation really seems to dampen the flavors.  I would like to try this on tap.11.2 oz bottle in a Melbourne Bros. glass.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text:
Bottle from Ginger Man.  Pours a brown/amber with no head.  Aroma is stewy with chestnut, pepper spices, and sweet apple.  Flavor of lots of spices and some light fruits in the background.  Rather quaffable.  I rather enjoyed my first authentic sahti.
7/4/7/4/13 [3.5/5]

Bottle; poured a light, muddy red with not even a faint trace of a head.  Aroma of fruit, caramel, sugar, yeast, with a sweet presence.  Flavor was unusual, but expected.  A little light and a touch watery.  Fruity and some caramel notes.  No hop notes obviously.  Some sweetness.  An ok beer overall.

33cl bottle.  No head atop murky brown body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, juniper berry, some raspberry, root beer, caramel.  Taste is moderately sweet, juniper, some berry, caramel, orange, light root beer.  Minimal carbonation, medium body, some stickiness.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2013 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Väinö, Helsinki. Very hazy, amber color, sweet aroma. No head. Yeast and sweet malt flavor.
Rerate 13.08.13. Amber color, white thin head. Baking soda,banana in aroma.flavor is similar with banana, yeasty notes, dough. Sweet. Three years later, still not a fan of sahti. 6 3 6 3 12
Unclear amber of color with a weak off white head. An aroma of apples, fruits and sweets. A flavor of apples, sweets and fruit.
Hazy, amber wit a tiny white head. Sweet with fruity notes. Malt, spices and fruit. Medium body with a sweet, fruity finish.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2010 SOPP Lahti.
Hazy orange body, no remarkable head. Aroma has banana and malty sweetness, flavour has some sweetness and yeast.
Muddy orange with a small white head. Aroma of banana yeast with a hint of sulphur, some grain and a little brunt rubber. Sweet grainy malt flavour and slightly tart.

Draught at Sahtimessi. Hazy orange colour with a very thin disappering head. The aroma is sweet, malt and yeast. The flavour is sweet and malty with notes of sourness, juniper and banana. Medium-bodied and sweet aftertaste. Very tasty Sahti.
Tasted 6/1/07 Helsinki, Finland. 50 cl bottle, muddy brown colour, spicy banana aroma. Mild carbonation, spicy hit and back of throat, strange but intriguing flavor.

From swingtop bottle. Hazy brown colour, some bubbles on top. Yeasty and spicy aroma with some underlying sweetness. Rather sweet, ryebread flavours, heavily spiced. Coriander. Slightly grainy, light-bodied. Interesting, if not exactly a personal favourite.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2015 1 000 ml bottle. BB 03/07/15. (Kotipizza) Tuulos, Finland.
Hazy reddish copper colour with no head. 
Strong banana, sweetness, mild juniper and mild sahti malt sweetness in the aroma.  Banana sweetness, alcohol, sahti malt, sweetness, spices and juniper in the flavour. Flat. 

500 ml bottle. Finland. BBE 28.02.09.
Hazy amber colour with no head.
Aroma: honey, banana and yeast.
Flavour: fruits (banana), wood and spices.
Sweet sahti.

Draught at SOPP, Lahti, Finland.
Hazy brown colour, no head.
Fruity banana and yeasty aroma.
Banana and yeast in flavour.

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of oh6gdx. Pours a hazy orangey golden with a pop-like head that dissipates in no time. Tart aroma of oranges and yeast. Medium-bodied, distinctly sour fruitiness and citrus and again yeast. Actually this is almost Gueuze-like in its sourness. No bitterness though. Quite interesting. 271209

Swing top bottle. 
Smells of pine and honney.
Tastes very sweet of sirup/honney and pine or resin flavour.
Well hidden alcohol.
UPDATED: JUL 31, 2016 Plastic bottle @ Sivukirjasto. Sweet, fruity and yeasty beer with notes of mild spices like cinnamon and clove. Nice soft mouthfeel. Drinkable and refreshing.

500 ml bottle. Hazy reddish orange colour, tiny head consisting of only a handful of big bubbles. Rich aroma of banana, yeast, berries and spices. Earthy, sweet malty flavour with banana and some other fruits, and a hint of alcohol. Medium-bodied and oily, very low carbonation.

Bottle - Red amber hazy beautiful body, some big bubbles in head; Very pleasant very apparent banana aromas in good nose; Very soft texture in very special body, very little carbonation bite, excellent; Long finish with tons of aroma, banana up front the juniper well hidden behind. Great!!!

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2014 Re-rating: Samplet from a 5 liter plastic container at Brewery Helsinki brewpub. Quite special, and a bit difficult to rate fair. Dark brown body with no head. Aroma has malt, bread, berries and an impression of forest. Flavor is relatively smooth malty, yeast, liquorice, hint of juniper and somewhat fruity. Almost no bitterness. Balanced in body and aftertaste in same style as main flavors. OK I guess, but not a favorite. 
  Old rating   
Bottled @ EBF 2008. Slightly hazy reddish orange body with a thin white head. Aroma is yeast, bread and a bit spicy. Flavor is fruity, some malt, herbs and notes of liquorices. A bit thin body. This was my first Sahti, and I was well prepared and looking forward to this. Maybe the expectations where to high. I was a bit disappointed, for me this was rather similar to a lot of average home brews and actually rather ordinary.

Bottle@Home. Malts, apple, lemon and banana aroma. Cloudy, orange/amber colour, small off-white head, fair lace. Sharp sour start, pretty sweet as well, lemon, apple, light bitter, banana, malty. Full and sticky. Had a couple of sahti now but this is the first I can appreciate a lot.

On tap at the European Beer Festival, Copenhagen. Serves an almost clear, golden body under an off-white head. Sweetish, spiced nose with citrus, pine and something more reminiscent of spruce than juniper. Spiced, sweet flavor with caramel and a citrusy fruityness. Quite thin body, but all in all a nice brew. Would like to have more. (080912)

200 ml glass @ Restaurant Aino. Murky rusty color, no head. Woody aroma with some candy notes and sour fruit. Syrupy malt flavor with a touch of alcohol and juniper. Full body, very low carbonation. Not bad at all, and it went great with the goat cheese cheddar it was served with.

Sampled at European Beerfestival Copenhagen 2008. 
Light orange nose, bubblegum.
Cloudy orange colour. Light mint , juniper flavor.
Medium to light body.
Smoke retronasal.
(EBF 2008). Golden color, white head. Banana and pine aple aroma, wheat bread, and some spices. Malty spicy flavor, banana, apples, wheat and some hops.

Draught @ OTTO fest - Oulu, Finland. Very hazy orange beer with some bubbls - no head. Aroma is very earthy and warm: thers lots of banana and yest in it. Sourish yeasty finish with no hops. Flavor is rich:  malty and fruity sweetness with a hint of alcohol in the finish. Palate is medium to full bodied, not much carbonated and quite thick in the finsih. Good stuff!

Draught at EBF. Hazy copper, firm pale head. Smooth banana aroma, vanilla ice-cream. Sweet banana syrupy flavor, smooth creamy maltiness, not much juniper. Nicely balanced and mellow, but ultimately quite simple. I’m sure I could have rated this one somewhere nearer, but I ran out of tokens on sunday eve..

Hazy orange color with minimal head. Aroma is sweet sahti aroma: banana fruity and sourish yeasty. Much banana in the flavor which is also much yeasty, very sweet and slightly alcoholic. Quite light-bodied and oily, very low carbonated, a bit sticky palate.

[on tap at EBF 2008]
Fruity aroma like a Tripel, but not musty, with fresh green apple and a Scottish ale caramel. Dark golden orange and hazy, with a lacy white top. Sweet orange flavour that is just a bit more orangey than a witbier. Some coriander and caramel and spicy black pepper. Very low bitterness--in need of more bitterness and/or carbonation to balance. Sweet finish with some black pepper, medium body, low carbonation.

Sampled at EBF08.
Very hazy amber with a tan head.
Yeasty and spicya roma; a bit weiss-like.
Sweet and sourish flavour. Some juniper and toffee/caramelle. A bit too sweet.

EBF2008. It’s warm golden with a heavenly aroma of malt, banana, yeast and juniper. The flavour has sweetness and notes of malt, penetrating juniper (in a nice way), banana, a light citrussy sourness, light honey and a very weak touch of smoke. It’s different from any other beer I have tasted, but it’s very, very harmonic and well balanced  I love it!

Bottle 50cl. w. sving top @ chris_os Pre-GBBF Shindig 2008.Hazy medium orange color with a virtually none appearance, virtually none lacing, fully diminishing head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, wheat, fruity, sourish, banana, junipeer - sweet and sour. Flavor is moderate sweet and acidic with a long to average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat. (020808)
Tap at EBF 2008, Copenhagen. Brown color, no head. Aroma is fruity. Flavor is sweet and fruity with a rustic touch.

Draught @ OTTO Festival. Mead colored, no head. Sweet banana and peach aroma with yeast. Flavor is yeasty hefeweisse like, bananas, chalk. Aftertaste is wonderfully unusual strongly  sweet-bitter citrus with pepper hints.

EBF @ Copenhagen, September 2008] Hazy dark amber color with a small white head that mostly diminished. Spare display of lacework. Aroma of banana, juniper, spice. Over the palate came malty base with an herbal feel. Medium bodied with a soft carbonation and mild dry alcoholic texture. Moderated sweet flavor with a hint of bitterness. Lingering banana and herbal finish.

On tap at EBF 2008, Copenhagen. Hazy amber. Very yeasty nose, like a Bavarian wheat beer. Then surprises you by tasting like banana milkshake! I know this is the Finnish beer of the year, but it didn’t do it for me at all.

Tap @ EBF, 2008, Carlsberg.
Pours a nice, clear coppery amber with a small, creamy, off-white, film head. Aroma has apples, toffee, caramel, coriander, oranges and light pepper. A bit flat, otherwise okay mouthfeel. Flavour is truly unique, good peppery spiciness, coriander and fresh oranges.
Draught at EBF 2008, on Saturday September 13Hazy golden color, off-white head. Estery banana scent. Estery banana taste. Sugary aftertaste. Medium to tmooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness.

On tap @ European Beerfistival. OK, Sahti, this is a first for me. Pours a hazy brown with a dimminnishing tanned head. Smells of baking yeast. Quite sweet with aromas of banana and. yeast. Hints of juniper. Bready and slightly sticky mouthfeel. Very low carbonation. Dry finish. Interesting.
Draught at EBF 2008. Hazy amber, medium off-white head. Fruity, Weizen-like, with tangerine and some barnyard notes. Medium bodied and smooth. A bit too sweet for my liking.
Bottle at chris_o’s tasting of new chaps. Alround rating: Wheaty, estery, lemon tart character, immence fruityness, banana. Everythign i want in a sahti, excellent stuff.
Bottle at ØLbaren - thanks to Yespr and Kasper. Cloudy orange - white head. Fruity, light sourness, berries, cactus, dryness, apples, pineapples, light barnyard -  is it brett ????
50 cL bottle, thanks to Ambassador. Pours hazy orange with a fully diminished head. Popcorn and mild citric aroma. Popcorn and citric flavour with a vague malt base. Citric and malty finish. Strange.
Bottle at Chris o’s...hazy orange, huge bbanana bubblegum nose,sweet fruity juicy banana bubble gum,littlle hop
Chris_o’s GBBF Shindig 08. Spicy, light and refreshing wheat beer. Like a Saison. Murky urine appearance. Some sweetness. Nice.

A Mes rate: bottle at Chris Os Pre GBBF Tasting.Thick, cloudy orange. Slight eggy notes in the aroma that were possibly not there when this was young. Tarty and wheaty. Sour lemon notes. Lots of sweetness. Very juicy and interesting. Lovely mouthfeel. Enjoyable.

Bottle at Chris_o pre GBBF Shindig 08.  Cloudy orange gold with thin white head.  Juniper and banana and vinegar on aroma.  It’s a bit shocking.  It’s kind of oily banana in mouth, some berry sting on end.  Not my kind of thing.
Hazy orange with tiny off white head. Sweet fruity with yeasty and berry notes. Flavor likewise.

at FatPhil’s & Anna’s home plastic jug  two days old 260708
Color:hazy amber
Taste:fresh strong combination of banana fudge and juniper. Alcohol level no show at all. Very enjoyable!

Thin very coarse white head does not cover the beer entirely. Hazy opaque amber body. Syrupy banana rye aroma with cloves, perfume, and alcohol notes. Also traces of juniper, wood, and grass. Very complex and quite fascinating. Sweetish grainy sugary rye and juniper taste with oily banana and cloves notes. Full-bodied and open palate with some alcohol heat. Aftertaste has yeast and alcohol. No real aftertaste. (0.5l bottle, Arkadia Alko, Helsinki.)
UPDATED: AUG 19, 2008 heavy Copper no head. Full bodied heavy in mouth but quite fresh and light for a sahti. banana, lots of smoke and a bit of juniper. easy to drink, fresh.

Bottled. A hazy dark golden beer with no head. The aroma is sweet - somewhat cloying with primary notes of baking yeast, as well as lighter notes of malt and herbs, as well as a hint of acidity. The flavor is sweet and acidic with strong notes of herbs - lots of different, as well as notes of berries - especially juniper, and notes of citrus and sulphur on a slightly malty back ground.

Bottle.
Hazy amber coloured with a small white head.
Aroma of yeast, peas, smoke and sulphur.
Light acidic flavour of fruits and smoke with notes of spices.

Bottled. My first Sathi ever, a big "thank you" to Baggio! Pours out in a opaque muddy orange colour with a low disappearing white foam. Big yeasty aroma with notes of cloves, banana, dried oranges with a mild undertone of juniper. Medium to full-bodied with notes of sweet banana, red berries, canned oranges, bakers yeast and juniper. Long warming finish of bakers yeast, orange-liquor, cloves, banana and sourish raspberries. Well-hidden alcohol. Very interesting, I definitely looking forward to my next sathi!

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2010 (Re-rate, from memory, several glasses at my sisters wedding, poured from a two litre swing top bottle) Poured bronwn and hazy. No head. Aroma was dominated by juniper and contained some sweet notes, too. Palate was medium bodied with low carbonation. Flavours were juniper, malts, sweetness and low bitterness. Aftertaste contained juniper and bitterness.

Old rating (total score only): 2.5

Draught in Zetor, Helsinki- Copper coloured and quite hazy with not much of a head. Medicinal aroma with some berries and also reminds me a bit of calpol. Bittersweet taste with a hint of sugar coated almonds which becomes more sweet in the aftertaste. Very tasty, nice and interesting although I do not think I could drink this all night (or indeed day!)

Swing top bottle from Tbone_. Murky orange brown color, no head. Citrus, yeast and hints of raspberry and twigs in the aroma. Sweetish, but also light sour flavor with juniper, red berries, yeast,, grapefruit and twigs. Not totally uncomparable with a fruity young lambic. Almost no carbon. Alcohol remains absolutely unnoticed. Looks ugly, but this is a delicious brew. Thanks Timo!

Draught at the Helsinki Beer Festival 2007. Hazy brown color. Sweet aroma with banana and flowery honey. Sweet, malty, nutty, spicy, minty, bready and chocolatey flavor. Some alcohol bite, a little juniper. Thick and smooth milk chocolate kind of texture with some oiliness. Quite sweet but still quite balanced.

Draught from a plastic jug at that tractor place in Helsinki. Peculiar glass, too.
Woody and smoky flavour from the juniper twigs. Sweet and sour. Nice to have a taste of how Nordic beers used to be. Campfire flavour lingering long in the mouth.

[swing-top bottle] Brown, muddy colour. Small, bubbly head. Malty, yeasty aroma with notes of cocoa powder and bubblegum. Complex flavour of malt, rye bread, cocoa, yeast, juniper, smoke, wood and fresh mushroms. Tastes like a walk in the deep Finnish woods! A little bit of alcohol shows up in the finish.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2008 Pours coppet with a crisp white head.  Smells of balsamic vinegar, juniper, lots of lactic hints, lemons, touches of bubblegum, sime resiny pine.  Tastes sour along the lines of older Alexander.  Lots of juniper, phenolic yeasty wheat beer hints, a lactic dry malty hint, lots of earthiness, mineral water.  Mouthfeel is full bodied.  Finish yields a lot of lactic greatness that compliments the juniper and the cloves present.  A near perfect beer that I wish was still available locally.

No head, deep brown color. Heavy, in-your-face aroma. Lots of bananas. Very fruity. Soft palate with very little carbonation. Some nice yeastiness. Very hefeweisse-like. Different for sure and positive as such.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2009 275ml bottle. The standard against which sahti is compared. And it never fails to demonstrate how superb the style is. Sweet, honey perhaps, and lots of bananas from the yeast. Dont be put off by it being flat - its supposed to be that way.
Rerate: jug (Zetor, Helsinki). Wow. Just wow. Gotta give this an extra point.

Bottle, 7.5%. A bit of mold and some malt in the aroma. Cloudy dark brown colour. Completely flat, no carbonation.The flavour is... different. Some yeast, spicy and piney, must be from the juniper. Peppery and malty bitterness in the aftertaste. Takes some getting used to, but not undrinkable.
Draught @ Kekri, Gallows Bird, Finland. Strong aroma of bananas. Some lingering head. Lacks a bit in taste, contains some yeasty notes.

Bottle at <a
href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Place/finland/ target=blank>One Pint Pub in Helsinki, Finland.  Orange-brown in colour, thin white head, no lace.  The aroma had lots of bananas, spices, some honey, light sweetness.  The flavour was quite sweet, lots of bananas, juniper berries, some honey, herbal, some pine-cones.  Lightly bitter mouthfeel, medium body, mild carbonation.  Finishes earthy, some sweetness, medium length.  Very weird stuff but quite enjoyable.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2007 (Bottle BB 06/2007) Banana and juniper aroma. Dark brown red colour, very hazy (murky after sedimentation poured in) and no head (couple of large bubbles). Sweet, banana, asparagus and juniper flavour. Sticky, flat carbonated (typical for sahtis) and medium to full-bodied palate with a hint of alcohol. Very good traditional Finnish sahti. 14/06/07 (previous ratings were 7/3/7/4/14, 5/3/7/4/14 and 6/3/6/4/14)

500 ml flip-top bottle - shared by DarkElf and supplied originally by bogdi1.  Poured cloudy, dark amber with little to no head - only a thin ring of bubbles around the rim.  Aroma is rich and sensual, dominated by fruit - just ripe bananas, honey and a bit of juniper. flavor is quite tart initially, very acidic and herby with the juniper evident, slightly astringent also with a bit of chemical - maybe turpentine? - in the finish.  Medium body and little to no carbonation.  This was an interesting one - many thanks to DarkElf for sharing!

(500 ml flip-top bottle: Obtained in trade with bogdi1, thanks Juha!, and shared with SDbruboy) One of the most rewarding things about sharing unique beers with friends is the fresh perspective they can give on a beer.  When I poured this Sahti, the first thing I noticed was bananas and because it was quite an abundant aroma, I just instinctively thought of ripe bananas.  But a friend who tried the beer corrected me and said it was unripe green/pale yellow bananas.  He was absolutely on the money, and now I will be able to identify that distinction from here on out.  Anyway, yes, the nose is dominated by the scent of a banana that you eat a day too early, the banana that is just starting to turn yellow and doesnt quite peel fully.  I also get a hint of sourness and some light smoke.  But wow, the flavor is vastly different from the aroma.  Mostly, tart citrus is in the foreground, tart and acidic with only a hint of sweetness.  Plenty of banana of course, and again, green banana, but the tart citrus is more prominent.  It has an herbal quality and no bitterness, and Im reminded slightly of coriander for some strange reason.  When I opened the flip-top bottle, hardly a pssst could be heard, and so carbonation levels are quite low.  Not a problem because even though there is minimal carbonation on the palate, the tart and acidic character of this Sahti is quite playful on the tongue and is an adequate substitution for the carbonation in terms of mouthfeel.  Light-medium bodied and quite refreshing, but I think Id prefer a touch more body.  Dark yellow-amber in color and fairly cloudy on the first pour, but subsequent pours are downright muddy.  Of course, the beer poured with almost no head, just a few random bubbles that clung to the edge of the glass.  Overall, quite a treat for me to sample yet another fresh Finnish Sahti, a traditional style that I obviously greatly enjoy.  Juha and I will just have to keep trading so that I can get my occasional fix in.

(Bottle)  Pours a murky burnt orange with a spare off-white head.  Complex aroma of wood, soy sauce, ginger, cooked cabbage, solvent, and chestnuts.  Flavor of sour fruit, spoiled V-8 juice, and spices.  Certainly an aquired taste.

Reading previous notes, I mayve gotten a contaminated bottle, or maybe I just dont get this style ... but to me, this one looked, reaked and tasted of rotten carrot juice.  It was excruciatingly tart and nasty.

Bottle in One Pint Pub, Helsinki.  Orangey, cloudy and totally flat with a wheat and bubblegum nose - like concentrated Hefewiezen! along with something else - pine trees or sap?  Intense sweet banana and bubblegum flavour with rich wheatiness, malt and a vague hint of the sappyness in the aroma.  Very complex finish.  Unusual but very interesting - ill look forwards to my next Sahti!

Tapped. Brown hazy colour, white bubbly head. Banana and fruity aroma with hints of berries. Smooth banana flavour with bitterish notes. Very fresh palate and bananaish longlasting, almost too sweet aftertaste. A bit sticky mouthfeel.
Keg @ Helsinki Beer Festival, Helsinki Finland Backlog 1 April, 2005Severly hazy. Smoked aroma with hints of pine forest and vomit. Chocolaty tastes with licorice undertones.

bottle from brickskeller (the bottle label was different, but I think its the same beer).  Beer: so.weird.  Low carbonation, light amber.  Aroma is confusing, very slight.  Flavor is very bizarre, and I can only explain it as too juniper-y.  This is my first sahti, and as a first impression, this falls flat.

Chickpeas, salt, smoke and sugar in the aroma.  Opaque tan with no head.  Still and flat looking.  Very sour, acidic and vegetal.  Salty.  Somewhat boozey and thin.  It would seem that either I dont understand what the brewers intended or perhaps this was not a prime example.  Bottle sampled with MartinT, muzzlehatch and Rastacouere at the Sunset Grill in Boston.

New England Road Trip Easter 05 with MartinT, tiggmtl and Rastacouere, beer #71.  Bottle at the Sunset Grill.  Still opaque orange...someone (Stephen?) mentions its similarity in color and aroma to Cantillon Fou Foune...perhaps...brie/camembert strong ammoniac old cheesiness, funky...vegetal..asparagus...definitely unique...the the flavor:  massively sour, old grapefruit juice with acidic woods and spices...too much for me, burning and stomach-turning, almost...massive burning chemical sensation as it goes down...no gueuze is this unpleasant.  Im glad I had it, but if all sahtis are like this, count me out of future tries...

From a flat, murky orange colour emerges an intensely sour and acidic funk which aptly follows the Cantillon Foufoune Ive just had...No idea if this is supposed to be like this though...Apricots, juniper leaves and woodiness bounce around with a little DMS impersonator...The toncels used as a punching bag...

Bottle at the Sunset grill. An off-white ring covers the orange-amber body. Weird aroma is extremely yeasty, very rice-like, bready and spiced fish like through its orange zest components and strong rye and urine notes. Extreme acidity level, very alcoholic, lingering peanut oil finish, fishy lemon post taste. Sharply acidic texture, aggressive, astringent. This is certainly very exotic and original, but I certainly dont believe this is supposed to taste like this. Extremely hard to drink.

Hazy golden amber, with the fastest receding head Ive ever seen.  Spicy wheaty aroma, touch of hefe-clove, as well as appley-spice.   Very odd, spicy sour flavor.  Starts with more apple spice,  with a little wheatiness in the middle and then heads to a sort of ketchupy sweet and sour thing, with an almost metallic nine volt battery zing.  Nutmeggy notes as well.  Talk about schizo...

EBF 05 - orange/amber pour with a large head.  Aromas of almonds and sourness.  Taste is quite herbal/earthy but I am picking up a distinct taste of almonds, very odd.  Slight grassy notes in the finish.  Hard to believe its 7.5%.

XBF05, bottle:  Cloudy orange with no real head.  Very heavy sharp aroma, I wrote down horse blanket, even though that quite isnt it.  Medium bodied, harshly sweet, with a touch of bitterness at the end.  Very strange.  I had a really hard time with this drink, as it was very different than anything that Ive had before.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2007 Bottle in a trade with Heemer77.  Thanks so much Eric, Id been badly wanting to try this!  Pour reveals a wonderful (in my opinion) looking beer.  I like heavily hazed, murky looking beers and this fit the bill.  Fiery orange, deep copper and gold hues all swirl about, with a small, moderately lasting white head.  Aroma of white wine vinegar, black pepper, salt, cabbage, rhubarb, and plenty of pickled beets right on the end.  Wow, this is going to be interesting.  And it certainly is.  Very sour, moderately acidic, with some strong, drying herb-like notes.  Resemblance to spoiled carrot/celery juice, perhaps. Very spicy as well, with a sweet-and-sour sort of effect.  It finishes with a strong bitterness, some salty malt like flavoring, but no real evidence of the cabbage/beets that I get out of the aroma.  Tingly mouthfeel, with a medium body, some wateriness.  Alcohol does not seem apparent.  I hope to try the rest of the Lammin line at some point.  Thanks so much Eric!<

Pours a hazy orange with a thin white ring of foam.  Dry, grassy, strawberry, and water chestnut aroma has a hint of pale malty sweetness.  Some hay, sweet and sour sauce, and spruce flavor bring out the body and a very interesting complexity.  Viscous palate leads to a dry tart finish.  A very weird style that Id like to try more of.  Thanks to heemer77 for bringing this to the Wisconsin gathering!

Bottled: Muddy water with no lace but that was expected. The aroma is funky and cheesy with major yeast notes. Also detected water chestnuts, mild grassy esters and noticeable juniper berry on the nose as well. The taste starts tart and spicy with a lot of sublime fruity undertones. Yeasty with a stange but nice depth of palate. Despite the tartness, but feel is smooth. The whole is unique indeed. Im am starting to develop a liking for this style. Seek out if you are looking for something very different. Thanks Heemer77 for bringing this to the party.

Pours a very cloudy/hazy Goldenrod color. Aroma of bananas, straw and grass. Very similar to the aroma of a Lambic. Flavor is sour wheat, Fruit (Im guessing juniper berries, or grapes) Palate has a sour dry bite to it. Very interesting, Thanks Heemer

Heemah!  Very cloudy pour - rust brown, no head.  Looks like the rusy contents of an old iron pipe.  Sweet n sour aroma - strawberries lemon pepper.  Big, tart flavor: raspberry, pale malt and lime tartness.  Neat stuff!  The flavors are jumbled around but interesting enough for a good score.

The color is a light reddish brown with some cloudiness. The aroma is sour lemons and fresh potatoes. The juniper aroma is more muted than the Olut. Also has a hint if cider. Plenty of fruit aromas. Lots of carbonation. The taste is funky with a sharp woody character. The finish is sharp and tangy, but not really sour.

poured a very cloudy unfiltered redish yellowish color.. smelled of rasberry/strawberry & pepper.. smelled a little sour but light and crisp.  The palate wa s a little bitter, but smooth, and lightly carbonated.  The flavor was sweet & bitter like a very mild lambic.  Definite fruit that I didnt recognize but I was told was the juniper berries.  Interesting beer I think I need to resample to form an opinion on.  Thanks to Heemer for bringing this one.

Shared this bottle with walleye.  He didnt like it, but he is weird. The aroma was, well interesting to say the least.  Smelled like a pickled turnip from the Beruit Place in town.  Not a good thing.  Copper color,like cider, with a white head.  The taste was vinegar sourness, mustyness, and woody all rolled into one.  I like it quite a bit, except for the smell.  I was told this was a bad bottle by the dude at the store, so maybe this has something to do with it.

bought at merchants in dearborn, was told by the person working the beer section that the beer was going to be sent back not a good batch stupid me I bought a bottle anyway. poured copper with a white head that didnt last long. aroma like the pickled turnips you get at a mid-eastern restaurant had a hard time getting past that, as the nose was pulled away got a hint of sweetness. flavor, not as bad as the aroma, vinegar, sourness, let this sit and warm up to see if flavor would change it didnt

Massive boiled peanut aroma. I mean literally peanuts.  Murky red-orange with a small white head. There are no peanuts antwhere in the flavor. Lemony, slightly tart, some vinegary acid. Sweetness comes through in the end.  Medium body, slightly sour. Interesting concotion.
Smells like lemon/banana muffins. Taste has a funky citrus pucker like tart lemon tree branches. 7.5% masked very nicely with a smoky flavor. The best sahtia I had that day by far.
Dusty deep gold.  Bizarre nose, bright and sugary alongn with sour tartness and some vinegar.  Tastes like lemonade mixed with juniper berries and some rauch-esque smoke.  Really intriguing stuff.

Poured a cloudy orange gold color with a small off white head and no lacing on the glass.  Sweet, orange, peach, cream, lemon, and spicy  juniper aroma.  Sticky sweet, sour, tart, lemon and honey taste.  Finishes dry, and lightly salted.

Bottle.  Hazed amber color with floating chunks.  Aroma is like a pile of grass clippings as they begin to decompose.  Taste is tart and sweet.  Citrus rinds and a sugary/honey sweetness mix.  Medium bodied.  Lots of strange flavors and aromas.  Strange, but really good.

almost milky like pour, nice golden honey color.  jtw describes the aroma very well...like sticking your nose in the little peanut bags they give you on the airplane.  This is a bit bizzare but not bad at all.  Flavor is sweet at first but doesnt finish as sweet as i would expect.  i guess id describe it as an herbal flavor...almost dirt like.  Body is thick but not sticky at all.    Some honey notes on the swallow.  I guess the only thing i could compare it to is DFHs Midas Touch.  Pretty good i think.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2005 unique herbal aroma, strangely enough there  is a prominent peanutty aroma.  lots of yeasty esters.  flavor is.....well.....unique.  lambic-like astringency, wheaty, warming sweetness in the finish.  spicy, cidery.  light tingle of alcohol that is just slightly accented by the low carbonation.  i expected it to be sweeter, knowing that it uses little to no hops, only herbs for bitterness.  sahti is certainly unique, and a tradition that i hope stays alive!

Bottled, Cavalier Dist trade show Cleveland:  Murky brown, very low carbonation.  Aromas of banana, cloves, and hints of chocolate.  From what little I know about sahti, I dont get much juniper out of the aroma, only hints.  I would think it would pick up more.  Theres also some hints of caramel.  Flavor is Bavarian weizen like with banana esters, clove, but with hints of chocolate.  Very low carbonation, actually pretty flat, medium body, and only mild alcohol warmth.  I wish I could get my hands on more of this stuff, but its going to be pretty limited in Ohio due to short shelf life.

This is coming into the states now, imported by B.United. Strangely caremelized, molasses sweetness on top of a funky country hay, woody and!! cheesy background. Full. Beyond unusual. Sampled at the Cavalier Trade Show, Cincy, while talking to one of the Two Brothers of IL about residual sugars left in barley.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Cloudy brown with very low and tough head. An heavenly aroma and flavor of choclat banana. I love it.

Cloudy and copperish color with no head at all. Bottle didnt make any whizz when opened, Im not sure if it should. Aroma has little bit of banana, but it is strongly overruled by yeast. Flavor has very malty and sweet start, but fast it changes to be pretty yeasty. I like this sahti over two Finlandias because of more yeast, but maybe one bottle at the time is enough. Id like to have some carbonation there, although warm feeling in the end without any alcohol taste is nice.

Bottled
Hazelnut - orange brown, hazy. Almost no head. Banana and juniper aroma. Crisp start, then very unique juniper berry and bean flavor. Very strange beer.

Hazy orange-amber color; poor carbonation, no head. Original aroma: beans; light fruitness (orange berries). A bit oily; herbs; sweet; sweet soy beans; boisée; light fruitness. The final is ok, but ends quite quicly, leaving only a light long herb bitterness.A very strange experience.

Light brown / orange, cloudy, no head. Sweet malty, banana-like and pretty yeasty aroma with notes of juniper. Medium body. Sweet, banana-like, malty flavor with notes of alcohol. Bit candy-like taste. Sweet malty finish.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2008 ([email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */) Sweet rye aroma with hints of alcohol. Flavor is sweet, but still refreshing with juniper present. Nice, but I still prefer drier ones.
(Bottled) Very muddy, reddish, dark brown color with practically no head. Sweet, banana aroma with a hint of potatoes and asparagus (yes, this one, too!). Sweet flavor with toffee, apple, asparagus and banana. Alcohol not present at all. Medium-bodied, slicky palate with absolutely no carbonation. Very easily drinkable! This is an ancient Scandinavian/Viking beer style, but (ironically, thanks to crazy Finnish laws) the oldest still working commercial sahti brewery in Finland (Lammin Sahti) was founded in - not 1387, but 1987!
Orange coloured. This is a very interesting style. Quite sour and yeasty with faint notes of juniper. I would love to try a fresh sahti.

Cloudy copper color.  Small head with nice lacing.  Funky fruity aroma, some juniper, allspice, peach?  orange candy.  Surprised at the acidity in this one!  Yeasty sourdough bread presentation, with mild fruity notes and curious finish.  A little burning in the finish, definite alcohol presence.  Nicely tart, almost balances the strong sweetness.  Sticky, almost candyish, but smooth and light on the palate, with a light fizziness.  Hints of light wood or smokiness?  I almost envision a strange hybrid of Berlinner Weisse, weizenbock, and wee heavy...?!  I enjoyed it though, and thanks to austinpowers for this rare treat.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2003 Truly enjoyable, though perhaps not for everyone.  Looks like a cloudy, orange, Weizenbock (and tastes a bit like one, too).  Smells of yeastiness and berries (juniper?).  Very little head, as befits the sahti style.  Noticeable alcohol kick.  Lots and lots of yeast sedimentation on the bottom.  Possibly no hops added (can't be sure).  Sweet fruit flavor and alcohol are dominant.  Enjoyable!

The bottle I tried was unfortunately too old. It was a couple of months. The beer had developed a lot of yeast and was very sour. However it is said that it is traditional and therefore good, and to that I hold!
dark orange colour, absolutely no foam, aroma of smoked bacon and apricot, herbal,  very low carbonation, sweet and sour, very long dry sour finish with fruity notes - a strange experience

UPDATED: APR 28, 2003 Bottle: Thanks Per.  Pour flat, no head, as cloudy as fall apple cider, slightly lighter in color.  Sweet, fruity, apricots, sour apples, and maybe nutmeg or clove.  This is neat brew, very much like a fall/winter seasonal weizen.

Pours with no head, extremely murky/cloudy, orange in colour. Aroma is very estery (banana, mango) and yeasty. Taste is quite sweet at first and the becomes tangy and citric, and the mouthfeel is like orange and mango fruit juice, and i also noticed a slighy clovy spicy character right at the end, there was also something Fantome-ish about it. Kind of reminded me of mango-weizen aswell, but with way more tang and sort of citric acidity. Even thoughi'm sure theres better examples of the style, it was still quite an interesting beer.

Straight up- I didnt know what to think of this. Very strange indeed. Might be better appreciated while in Finland, rather then a hot Texas afternoon- Color was opaque orange: almostlike a mix of orange juice and tomato juice. No head- perfectly still. Aroma of malt, orange and yeast. Tart and tinny. Definitely some cirtus notes. Juniper. Completely and utterly still- not a bubble in sight. Unusual. Notes of bile! Almost milk-like mouthfeel. No hint at all of the alcohol. An acquired taste I am sure.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2003 Re-rate draught at Helsinki Beer Festival.
Orange coloured, very hazy. Sweet and estery with notes of apricot and banana and juniper. The draught version is fresher and more complex then the bottle I've previously sampled, but then sahti more or less starts deteroriating the second it's bottled.
Very sweet, cloying rendition of the style; lots of malt, juniper, shredded coconut - sticky finish, no carbonation (as per style), little bit of herbal character.
